en: The EU Prize for Literature at the Frankfurt Book Fair 2015
Winners of the 2015 edition will be celebrated in a photo exhibiton running from 14-18 October 2015 at Frankfurt Book Fair.
58-Document for general distribution (intended for the general public)
Winners of the 2015 European Union Prize for Literature will be celebrated in a photo exhibiton running from 14-18 October 2015 at Frankfurt Book Fair.

The European Union Prize for Literature, awarded annually, is a unique prize that honours new and emerging literary voices in Europe, regardless of nationality, age or language.

In total, 84 books from 37 different European countries have received the Prize since it was launched in 2009. The winning books constitute a wide range of high quality fiction produced across Europe – a literary gold mine.

The Frankfurt Book Fair is the world's largest trade fair for books; there are 7000 publishers, 300.000 visitors and 9.000 journalists – and over 100 countries are represented. The Frankfurt Book Fair promotes the books and authors of the EU Prize for Literature and devotes a photo exhibition, set up in prime location, to the 12 prize winners in 2015:

  • Carolina Schutti (Austria)
  • Undinė Radzevičiūtė (Lithuania)
  • Luka Bekavac (Croatia)
  • Ida Hegazi Høyer (Norway)
  • Gaëlle Josse (France)
  • Magdalena Parys (Poland)
  • Edina Szvoren (Hungary)
  • David Machado (Portugal)
  • Donal Ryan (Ireland)
  • Svetlana Žuchová (Slovakia)
  • Lorenzo Amurri (Italy)
  • Sara Stridsberg (Sweden)
